entry.content:

detect if the app has been backgrounded or not. To prevent the

reoccurence of removing the observer, we move these observers to the

service instead of the TabHelper.

entry.title: [iOS] Introduce ShellColorChooserIOS
entry.content:
This CL enables WebContentsDelegate::OpenColorChooser

on iOS to create a color chooser with UI components supported

on iOS framework and introduces ShellColorChooserIOS that

would have UI controller and coordinator.



Chromium uses mainly ColorChooserPopupUIController for all

platforms except Android.

With this CL, if PagePopupEnabled() is false, ContentShell on

iOS calls the delegate method to create a color chooser, not

using ColorChooserPopupUIController.



Bug: 1467802

entry.title: Address CmdLineURLRestartTest flakiness
entry.content:
The test was failing intermittently due to an incorrect UseCounter

count. This change updates the way UseCounters are synchronized.

Previously this code relied on calling Navigate to ensure UseCounters

were flushed.



Instead, we now use content::FetchHistogramsFromChildProcesses and

metrics::SubprocessMetricsProvider::MergeHistogramDeltasForTesting.

These functions ensure that base::HistogramTester sees histograms/metrics for all subprocesses. These functions require that there is no race between the call to FetchHistogramsFromChildProcesses

and the child process shutting down. To ensure this doesn't happen, we make sure we read these values in a loop, similar to other usages of

these functions.



Bug: 1448030

Change-Id: Ie32699424f0a837d33a4861407b22085160f2cb1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4722166

Commit-Queue: Mike Jackson

Reviewed-by: Tommy Nyquist

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176405}

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/s/app_services/p/c/app_type
entry.content:
The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile some dependants who do not depends on base explicitly.



Bug: chromium:1467773

Change-Id: I835eeaf5a41099a8854d6b438d488565d6b39c46

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4725264

Auto-Submit: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: [ios] Merge //base/ios into //base
entry.content:
The target //base/ios was separate because it contained file that

required ARC to be enabled but //base could not enable it because

it also listed some Objective-C++ file that would not compile if

ARC was enabled.



With recent changes that converted all Objective-C++ code in the

codebase to require ARC, this distinction is no longer needed. It

become problematic to have two separate targets because developer

put direct dependencies on //base/ios instead of //base (incorrect)

which causes dependencies issue in some case.



Bug: 733237

Change-Id: I4314a5b80346dd9aefea319ea3718eb8c3990dd5

entry.title: Add event observers in the WebsiteMetrics component
entry.content:
This change introduces new event observers in the WebsiteMetrics

component so subscribers can be notified of URL opened/closed events

within a render frame. This also fixes an issue where we perform cleanup

tasks more than once if active tab is removed forcing window closure.



Changes for supporting external website usage tracking will be done in

CLs following this one.

entry.title: inputs: wrap mako webui with page handler
entry.content:
This CL adds a wrapping class around the MakoUntrustedUI web ui

controller. This wrapper provides the lifetime controls required by the

EditorMediator class (opening and closing an instance of the web ui) and

removes the need for the static MakoUntrustedUI::Show() method. The

wrapper also abstracts any details required to construct the web ui,

whilst providing a very simple interface to control the web ui.

Contrary to its name, basic.html had grown to be a grab-bag of tests.

This takes the first step of splitting it up, creating a separate test

for event properties, and one for what happens when you invoke various

previously in basic.html, in that it also tests the cancel event's

properties.

in basic.html. It uses the createRecordingCloseWatcher helper to check

the exact events that are fired, and confirm that destroyed close

watchers stay destroyed.

entry.title: Reland "[VC] ukm logging for arc++ apps."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a3ab73187fdf1bb0fa65df9cfa28d56259f6dce8



Suprisingly the best fix for now is to just remove the duration check.



The issue happened because if the duration is less than 10ms, it is

bucketized into 0 by UKM.

The proper fix would be make the delay longer.



I have considered these options.

(1) change the test into an unit test and use BrowserTaskEnvironment;

this can't be done easily because the whole class heavily depends on

Profile, User, VideoConferenceManager etc.



(2) use a tick_clock and overwrite that in test. this can't be easily

done because we have to pass the clock into each VideoConferenceUkmHelper which is implicitly created and stored in the

client; which means several steps of assignment.



Given the duration is already tested in VideoConferenceUkmHelperTest,

Here in this test we can focus more on the triggering and

bool values of the UKM log.



We can have a more complicated fix later on if required. But not in

this reland.



Original change's description:

> [VC] ukm logging for arc++ apps.

>

> (1) each vc app_id is also mapped to a ukm_helper.

>

> (2) ukm_helper records the start and stop of camera and microphone

> capturing.

>

> (3) ukm is logged when the app is closed.

>

> Bug: b/266004750

>

> Test="autoninja -C out/Test chrome/test:browser_tests && out/Test/browser_tests --gtest_filter=VideoConferenceAppServiceClientTest"

>

> Change-Id: I8a7331960de999e48cb7a065a0c64e7804a85684

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4674930

> Commit-Queue: Charles Zhao

> Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169660}

entry.title: Set selection bounds if needed before showing the touch selection menu.
entry.content:
On ChromeOS, tapping the caret should show an insertion handle and

toggle showing the touch selection menu. The bounds of the handle and

menu are set based on the selection bounds of the

TouchSelectionController, however, these selection bounds can be reset

between the time the caret is placed and the time the caret is tapped

again (e.g. if the mouse was moved after placing the caret). In such

cases, tapping the caret makes the menu appear at the wrong spot (top

left of the web content) and the handles don't appear.



To fix this, check if the TouchSelectionController was reset and

re-notify it of the most recently used selection bounds if needed before

showing the menu. This should ensure that the TouchSelectionController

has valid selection bounds when we try to show the handle and menu.



Bug: b:286476233

entry.title: Fix <a>'s href getter to return the attribute value for invalid URL
entry.content:
The CL is a part of the URL Interop 2023.



The anchor element 's href should return the content attribute

value as is if the invalid URL is set in its setter.



For example, Chromium fails the following test because `a.href`

returns "http://%00/#a", instead of "http://%00#a".



const a = document.createElement("a");

a.href = "http://%00#a";

assert_equals(a.href, "http://%00#a");



This behavior is non-compliant with the standard [1].



There is a WIP CL [2] which attempts to fix this issue. The difference

between the previous one and this CL is:



- The flag is now Blink's RuntimeEnabledFeature

- The flag is enabled by default. This CL doesn't add VirtualTests.



Since the flag is now enabled by default, we have to rewrite

Chromium's internal web_tests which rely on the current non-compliant

behavior.



Since `a.href` is used internally as an implementation of

canonicalize() function [3] in web_tests, we have to rewrite many

URL's canonicalization web_tests defined mostly in fast/url/.



In contrast, we don't need to rewrite any WPT tests. They are all

correct.



As discussed in the previous CL, we don't send I2S for this change.





Rebaselines:



This CL includes many rebaselines. [4] is a diff before adding

rebaselines, which might be helpful to understand the main change.



Most rebaselines are understandable. Here are some notes for the record.



a-element-origin-expected.txt:



> FAIL Parsing origin: against assert_equals: origin

> expected "null" but got ""



This is due to https://crbug.com/1416022.



The reason of PASS previously is that Chromium has two bugs which

*accidentally* made this test PASS.



Previously:



1. Chrome fails to parse against (1st issue)

2. anchor.Url() wrongly returns invalid URL as is (2nd issue)

3. anchor.origin return null for the URL.



After this CL:



1. Chrome fails to parse against (1st issue remains)

2. anchor.Url() returns null URL (after this CL)

3. anchor.origin return empty "" for null URL



Expected behavior [5]:



1. Chrome parse against successfully

2. anchor.Url() returns its URL

3. anchor.origin return null for the URL



- [1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/links.html#dom-hyperlink-href

- [2] https://crrev.com/c/4379704

- [3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/url/resources/utilities.js

- [4] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659525/0..8

- [5] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/links.html#dom-hyperlink-origin



Bug: 1415986

Change-Id: Id0397a66f614f32757c7d19771cd694a9ba03556

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659525

Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

Reviewed-by: Xiaocheng Hu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176367}

entry.title: video-conferece:Update to autohide shelf behavior
entry.content:
Previously autohidden shelfs were shown if a VideoConferenceMediaState

update was sent, but this is not sent when apps begin capturing unless

the media state also happened to update.



Now that HandleClientUpdate was landed, we get poked when a new app

begins capturing. So respect that signal instead.



Change-Id: I31e04c29a4e0c6b7353047d9fe30c7f20faf7d39

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4718109

Commit-Queue: Alex Newcomer

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176361}

entry.title: Disable event handling while tray is hiding
entry.content:
This CL addresses an issue where you could click on the notification

center tray while it was running its hide animation, which could result

in an empty notification bubble popping up. It fixes the problem by

disabling event handling for trays while they are running their hide

animations. The event handling gets re-enabled when the hide animation

ends or is interrupted.



Fixed: b:293174118

entry.title: [ntp] Move Customize Chrome feature flag to //ui/base
entry.content:
This is in preparation for http://crrev/c/4722469, which will

establish a dependency between Customize Chrome and Chrome Refresh

feature flags. Establishing that dependency is difficult since the

Chrome Refresh features flag lives in a different GN component as

the Customize Chrome one, and, thus causes problems with component

builds (crbug/1467734). Therefore, this CL moves the Customize Chrome

feature flag into the same component as Chrome Refresh, and, so, makes

the layering more straightforward.



Bug: 1457991

entry.title: Change SiteInstanceGroup observers to be checked
entry.content:
SiteInstanceGroup has a list of observers, which were previously

UncheckedObservers. There are no legacy observers so they can instead

be CheckedObservers, which is the safer option.



A unit test was added, though it passes both before and after this

change.



Test: SiteInstanceGroupTest.ObserverListReentrance, No Behaviour Change

entry.title: Add kNoCors security disclaimer in network::ResourceRequest
entry.content:
The "no-cors" fetch mode is highly discouraged for security reasons, however it is the default for both the Fetch Standard [1] and in the

network service. This CL adds documentation encouraging those setting up

new network::ResourceRequests to re-consider using `kNoCors`, and only

do so with deep justification and security team buy-in.



R=jyasskin@google.com



Bug: 1383340

entry.title: Add some metrics for measuring the impact of navigation queueing.
entry.content:
Non-MHTML (aka regular) and MHTML navigations have separately recorded

metrics since loading a MHTML archive requires extra work at commit time

in the renderer process, which delays the DidCommitNavigation back to

the browser process.



Unfortunately, this only adds a test for the metrics for non-MHTML

navigations. A MHTML navigation cannot load subresources from outside

the MHTML archive, but the tests require an infinitely loading page to

avoid potential flakes.



Bug: 1220337

entry.content:
BookmarkEventRouter implements BookmarkModelObserver::

BookmarkAllUserNodesRemoved with a comment that this is only called

on Android, not on desktop. However, this is not true, and the

respond to this event in the Bookmarks API.

entry.title: Node connected check should also check owner shadow hosts
entry.content:
We should not create AXObjects for, or process changes for nodes that are not "connected".



A node can return true for node->isConnected(), but be inside of a

shadow root, where the shadow host is not connected. This CL replaces the a11y code's isConnected() checks with a helper that determines whether a node and all of its shadow hosts are connected.

entry.title: [phrase-line-break] Tentatively add `word-break: auto`
entry.content:
CSSWG resolved to change the property:

> RESOLVED: remove auto () from word-boundary-detection, add

> keyword to word-break for this functionality

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7193#issuecomment-1611772475



The new keyword name is still under a discussion, `auto`,

`phrase`, `auto-phrase`, or something else. This patch

tentatively add the `auto` keyword, in order to move the

development forward, matching the WebKit WIP[1], but plan to

rename when it's resolved before shipping.



Tests will be added when the final keyword is resolved.



[1] https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/pull/15402



Bug: 1443291

entry.title: Polish how glanceables bubble container resizes
entry.content:
Track when the prefererd size of individual glanceable bubble views

changes, new glanceables view get added, or when glanceables view

visibility change and update the glanceable tray bubble bounds in each

of those cases. This ensures that the glanceable tray bubble bounds grow

as new glanceable views get added to the scrollable bubble container

(which happens asynchronously after the bubble is first shown).



Additionally, when the glanceable views container height changes (e.g.

because a new glanceable view gets added, or a glanceable view's size

changes upon selecting a different list), update the glanceables tray

bubble view scroll view offset so it appears that the glanceables UI is

growing upwards (i.e. try to keep the bottom of the scroll view

constants). As special case, ensure that the currently focused view is

scrolled to be visible, to reduce jankiness when the user selects a list

that causes the glanceable to grow and move the dropdown control out of

the screen bounds.



BUG=b:293391626

entry.title: Require exact expectation counts for print browser tests
entry.content:
Update CheckForQuit() helper method to assert that it doesn't get more

calls to check for than were expected. Such a condition is a signal

that a test is not accurate in its expectations, which could lead to

exiting too early. This is often a cause of test flakiness.



Make corrections to tests and test-support methods to ensure

expectations are exactly met:

- Correct BrowserPrintingContextFactoryForTest so that canceling from

AskUserForSettings() works for all platforms that have a system

print dialog, not just the ones that support that dialog OOP. The

prior behavior was causing Linux tests to expect the print job to be

canceled when in fact it was instead proceeding through to

completion.

- Correct SystemAccessProcessSandboxedServicePrintBrowserTest's test

StartBasicPrintConcurrent and also

SystemAccessProcessSandboxedServicePrintBrowserTest's test

SystemPrintFromPrintPreviewConcurrent to actually print for Linux.

Without Linux OOP system dialog support, if the system dialog cancels

then there is currently no event to signal that has occurred. To get

a signal to know when the test can exit, just let the test print to

completion for these special cases.



Change-Id: I933fe663b75e30e0e2aa0a709073d783dd30ec1f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727161

entry.title: inputs: Add lacros browser tests for changing the input method.
entry.content:
When Ash changes the current input method, Lacros can observe aspects of

the input method, such as the XKB layout.



Add a new test Mojo API to tell Ash to change the current input method.

To change the input method, Ash needs to install a new fake "extension"

with a single input method registered to it.



Make the design extendable to other aspects of the input method, such as

the language and text direction (these are not implemented in Lacros

yet).

entry.title: Fix Race with XrSessionCoordinator destruction
entry.content:
With both Cardboard and ArCore using the XrSessionCoordinator, it is

possible for there to be a race between one device tearing down a

session and the other being destroyed, resulting in one device trying

to destroy their instance of the XrSessionCoordinator while the other

device has an ongoing session. In this case sActiveSessionInstance would

not be null as we previously asserted. This change fixes the assertion

to more accurately reflect what we want which is that we are not trying

to destroy an XrSessionCoordinator that is responsible for an active

session.



Change-Id: I5e9951801b2835dc67f53a95c8b0dadb2da77cdd

entry.title: [iOS] Move unopened_downloads_tracker to a different file
entry.content:
Keeping track of the unopened download is independant of the download manager coordinator. Indeed, Chrome should keep track even after the manager is dismissed.

In order to ensure the download manager coordinator is stopped when its view is dismissed, it means another class should own the unopened download tracker. Hence this class should be able to access it. Hence we need to declare it in the header. Let’s move it to a different file at the same time.



Bug: 1467048

entry.title: [iOS] History stops CBD if it exists.
entry.content:
According to crbug.com/1464966, it is possible that a view controller is asked to open twice the same view.

The recommended solution according to chat discussion with the chrome ios team is to stop the already existing one before opening a new one.



This is probably what caused crbug.com/1467030. `displayPrivacySettings` gets called twice, setting the `historyClearPBrowisngDataCoordinator` property twice, with the first one not being stopped. This cause indirectly the mediator not to be disconnected as it should be.



R=jlebel



Fixed: 1467030

No behavior change because the support is added but not used yet. Add

a new SigninPromoViewStyle that only displays the primary button with

entry.title: prefetch: Use higher priority for more conservative candidates.
entry.content:
There is more that could be done here especially with real-world data,

but at a minimum it seems reasonable to do this much. "Conservative"

prefetches are now sent at HIGH (the same as early scripts and most

fetchpriority=high subresources) and "moderate" prefetches are now sent

at MEDIUM (the same as later scripts and subresources), but still lower

than the most critical subresources of the current page.



This has a slight perverse effect that in the case of request queuing,

an attempt to trigger _more_ eagerly actually results in the prefetch

occurring later. To fix that, we'd need to look at the actual engagement

signals rather than just the candidate's declared eagerness, and

potentially adjust it dynamically. That's more than the few LOC that I'm

trying to fit in this quick CL.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Add UMA histograms for web contents accessibility
entry.content:
This CL continues the Auto-disable Accessibility feature work.



With this CL we add three new histograms that will track the usage of

the accessibility engine as it compares to the general time usage of

a given Tab/WebContents instance. We track the time that a WebContents

object is shown and hidden, and record the time between the two (this

can happen more than once per Tab). We also track when the native

accessibility code is lazily initialized (which may not be the same as

when the WebContents was shown), and record the time since then when a

WebContents is hidden. In the special case where these two times are

nearly the same (sans some noise), we record the time in a separate

histogram. This will allow us to compare the average time that

accessibility services are enabled in general, vs. the amount of time

that accessibility services are enabled for users that enable the

services 100% of the time.

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Add ability to round the background of SidePanel
entry.content:
As part of MNext, we need to round all four corners of ash browser

frame. In order to round the bottom two corners of browser frame, if

side panel is visible, we need to round the bottom corners of

SidePanel based on its alignment.



This CL add the ability to round the background of SidePanel.

As part of MNext effort, all four corners of window frames are needed

to be rounded in ChromeOS. This API will be used to round one of

the bottom two corners of SidePanel based on what contents are visible

(SidePanel, DevTools,MainContent) to have a rounded frame.



Bug: 1415486, b:287060338

Change-Id: Ia142b8556fec8b07357381e1590ba6b8736c52e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4702366

Reviewed-by: Caroline Rising

Commit-Queue: Zoraiz Naeem

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1176276}

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Notify SidePanelViewStateObservers when panel is
entry.content:
opened



This CL updates the SidePanelViewStateObserver interface to add a method

that will be called when SidePanel is visible.



In future CLs, we will update the browser frame rounded corners based

on when the SidePanel is shown or hidden in ChromeOS. This is required

as based on which contents are visible (SidePanel, DevTools,

MainContent), we need to adjust what corners of these contents are

rounded to have a rounded frame.

entry.title: [iOS] Remove safe area inset dependencies from NTP
entry.content:
Anchors NTP content within the safe area layout guide to prevent any

dependencies on safe area insets when performing NTP operations. This

allows us to move scroll position logic freely without breaking

anything and greatly simplifies height calculations.

entry.title: [Static Layout] Fix doneHiding()
entry.content:
In StaticLayout call super.doneHiding() at the end of the override

rather than the beginning. In some cases doneHiding() may re-show the

layout causing mIsActive and the TAB_ID to be in an incorrect state.



A regression due to resetting the TAB_ID was introduced in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4663171



It is surprising that the issue with mIsActive was not a source of

problems in the past. This might explain some flickering behavior

seen previously.



Demo of fix (compare to video for first bug):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lhbMybO7-9UuxZz5aSlQ8Zz8Kp03em_u/view?usp=drive_link



See first bug for a reliable repro. Second bug is a possible repro

that is very occasional, but has similar characteristics.



As a follow up I'll look to add a test for this case. Unfortunately,

the reliable repro relies on self-sharing through the Android

share sheet which isn't easy to replicate in a test environment.



Bug: 1468214, 1467884

Change-Id: I28a6dcf38b78ef9fa69ea2ffe08d7e20df3f8ed5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4725612

entry.title: [TestLauncher] output running tests in gtest
entry.content:
If a test is being killed by infra, it won't output anything and it's

fairly hard to tell which test was running previously.

E.g. https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=63a605835c851b10

I cannot tell which test stuck forever before the entire task being

killed.

So this change logs the running tests before really starting them up.

entry.title: Hide media metadata from media controllers if required
entry.content:
This CL implements the ability for embedders to obscure the media

metadata from the OS's media controllers. This media metadata will

simply be replaced by some placeholder metadata.



This is done by making use of the embedder-specific MediaSessionClient

API to both check if we need to obscure the media metadata and also get

the placeholders we should replace the media metadata by.



As in Chromium's case the implementation of the MediaSessionClient API

(ChromeMediaSessionClient) specifies that the media metadata should be

hidden if its playing in an Incognito session, that will be the new

behavior introduced by this CL.



The actual obscuring of the metadata is just implemented by

intercepting calls to the SystemMediaControls API and replacing the

metadata with placeholder metadata when needed.



Bug: 1447545

entry.title: [AutofillDataModel] Set up i18n API baseline for address models.
entry.content:
The CL introduces the first set of per country rules for dynamic

hierarchies. It also creates the initial skeleton for the API that will

provide clients with access to international address models.



In the initial setup, the API supports fetching a per-country address

model that is built at runtime from the set of rules. Only a small list

of migrated countries is currently supported.

entry.title: [UNO] Use bookmark uuid instead of id in ShoppingService
entry.content:
Depending on the bookmark account storage opt-in status,

ShoppingService has to use either LocalOrSyncable storage or Account

storage. To make sure that wrong bookmarks aren't used by

asynchronous methods in ShoppingService, this CL replaces usages of

bookmark ids with uuids. This usage is internal to ShoppingService

(ids aren't shared with any other service), so there should be no

behavior change.

entry.content:

localized Windows, it defaults to local character encoding (like

cp1251.py). As a result build fails with UnicodeDecodeError when

working with UTF-8 files.

entry.title: Parallelize context_lost tests
entry.content:
Enables parallel tests in the context_lost GPU test suite.



Rough sample speedups:



Linux

Intel Release: 2m24s -> 1m48s (~1.33x speedup)

NVIDIA Debug: 3m3s -> 2m3s (~1.49x speedup)

NVIDIA Release: 2m28s -> 1m51s (~1.33x speedup)

Mac

AMD Debug: 5m56s -> 4m20s (~1.37x speedup

AMD Release: 4m14s -> 2m59s (~1.42x speedup)

Intel Debug: 6m4s -> 4m24s (~1.38x speedup)

Intel Release: 3m46s -> 2m20s (~1.6x speedup)

M1 Release: 3m8s -> 1m58s (~1.59x speedup)

M2 Release: 3m10s -> 1m54s (~1.67x speedup)

NVIDIA Release: 3m40s -> 2m27s (~1.5x speedup)

Windows

Intel Release: 3m50s -> 2m8s (~1.8x speedup)

NVIDIA Debug: 3m35s -> 2m17s (~1.57x speedup)

NVIDIA Release: 3m39s -> 2m5s (~1.75x speedup)

entry.title: [iOS] Reenable testPriceTrackingIsNotVisibleInIncognito
entry.content:
This EG test was originally disabled due to flake. After investigation,

it was identified that the test was able to signin into the app via the

recent tabs page, but it couldn't exit the recent tabs UI. This is

because the EG test would scroll down to tap on the signin button, but

it wouldn't scroll up to tap the dismiss button. Thus, the ability to

swipe up and locate the dismiss button was added.
